translation: You have the right to work, but never to its fruits.
He who knows both knowledge and ignorance together overcomes death.

text: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते।
translation: Nothing is as purifying as knowledge.
Better is one's own duty though devoid of merit than the duty of another well performed.
Dharma protects those who protect it.
Seeing Arjuna thus overwhelmed with compassion and sorrow, with eyes brimming with tears...

text: न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः।
translation: Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings.
The goddess who dwells in all beings as power, I bow to her.
